study_plan_entry.title: Fourier analysis and boundary value problems

free_text.Learning outcomes: Learning Fourier Series and Boundary Value Problems with a view to a variety of science and engineering problems. Learn the use of special functions via Bessel functions and applications. Introduce the doctoral students to general Sturm-Liouville problems and applications. The general aim of the course is to provide the doctoral student a necessary, if seldom directly related to one's research, toolkit of mathematical methods.
free_text.Content: Textbook: J.W. Brown, R.V. Churchill, Fourier Series and Boundary Value Problems, McGraw Hill, 7th ed, 2008[br/][br/]Fourier Series; Convergence of Fourier Series; Partial Differential Equations of Physics; The Fourier Method; Boundary Value Problems; Fourier Integrals and applications; Orthonormal sets; Sturm-Liouville problems and applications; Bessel functions and applications.[br/]
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Calculus Classes for Engineering or Science Degrees
